header.title: Empty podium as Boris Johnson cancels Brexit conference after being booed
header.postText: Boris Johnson was forced to cancel a press conference with the prime minister of Luxembourg, after being met with loud boos from protestors.', 'Prime Minister Xavier Bettel spoke with an empty podium next to him.', 'Two lecterns had been set up on the ministry’s grounds in Luxembourg City where the media was waiting to hear the pair speak after a meeting.', 'However, Mr Johnson decided to only give a statement to a small group of journalists assembled at the nearby residence of the British ambassador, after dozens of demonstrators with a loud speaker heckled him from behind the gate.', 'One of the protestors could be heard saying: ‘We don’t give a flying flamingo’.', 'Luxembourg’s prime minister, speaking at his now solo press conference, said: ‘I know that the UK Government is unhappy with the Withdrawal Agreement as it stands.', '‘That’s why I thought it was important to speak to Prime Minister Johnson to get proposals.', '‘We need more than just words.’', 'There needed to be a legally operational text to work on ‘as soon as possible’ if the October deadline was to be met, he added.', 'It comes after the prime minister was jeered and mocked by protesters earlier, after showdown talks with EU commission president Jean-Claude Juncker over lunch at a restaurant.', 'Mr Bettel is alleged to have told protesters they were ‘welcome’ and added that the EU would not grant another extension, without a good reason.', 'Following the earlier talks between Mr Juncker and Mr Johnson, the commission said Mr Johnson had still not made legally operational proposals to replace the backstop – the controversial contingency measure which keeps the UK closely tied to EU rules to prevent the return of a hard border with Ireland.
header.socioLingVar: Ethnicity - Asian (East- China, Japan, Korea, Philippines, Vietnam),Ethnicity - Black,Age - Over 65s,Nationality - European or anti-Europeans

commentThread.commentText: What a disgrace. The prime minister of Luxembourg - population about the same as Croydon - deliberately subjects our PM to a hooting jeering mob and then showboats in front of them and enjoys their cheers.I sincerely hope this shameful set-up backfires on Bettel and boosts Johnson. Bettel has disrespected our country and every one of us.

replies.commentText: No, just Mr Johnson
Johnson does represent this country, he's willing g to sell us down the river to America, he only has his own self interests at heart, shameful!
No, Just Johnson
Peter Fraser Who represents our country then, Swinson, Corbyn, Sturgeon, or perhaps whoever occupies the single seat the Greens have ?
Haven't you noticed that Bobo doesn't have to go too far to be heckled and booed?  It's been happening a lot since he became PM.  It's not just Luxemberg. x
haha you dickhead
Michael Pilgrim Derr you're smart.

commentThread.commentText: The buffoon bottles it again. The incredible sulk, Johnson hates scrutiny. At the press conference last week with the statesman Leo Varadkar, Johnson only contribution was to pull faces and wave his arms about. He should stick to the comedy act, like dangling from zip wires and hosting HIGNFY. He simply isn't PM material.

replies.commentText: Do you really think Xavier Bettel is PM material ?
Dave Thomas he was talking about Johnson he's our concern because he's the idiot leading this country!

Peter Fraser And Bettel was the idiot milking a crowd of protestors to swell his own popularity. I wonder what the real EU negotiators think about him disrespecting one of their biggest trading partners ?

Dave Thomas I don't really care to be honest Johnson is the one selling this country down the river, he's the one who has  told lie after lie to serve his own ends right now while we're in this self afflicted sh!t show, I'm not overly concerned about what Bettel is doing and from what you're saying it doesn't sound half as bad as what Johnson is doing

Marty Monroe - You obviously only read headlines and make your judgments from those in the (mostly) left-wing media.  Bettel's lack of good manners was appalling - how rude not to have prevented the rabble from getting so close that neither he nor Mr Johnson could be heard - and then mocking the latter at the "press conference" later.  You don't treat a head of state like that, whether you like him or not - especially if you're only the head of a tiny little country like Luxembourg whose population is only a tenth of Britain's - and almost half of those are foreigners.
Got that wrong - Luxembourg's populations is only about a HUNDREDTH of Britain's.

Hmm, good use of English there, I'm going to say again, your comments have no substance and you are fake. Your English is quite poor also........

Iain McIntyre coming from Scotland, I think you will find a lot of English people find it hard to understand your fake English language.

commentThread.commentText: Why the hell do people in other countries feel they have any right to interere with my democracy or the domocracy of the others who make up the 17.4 million? These idiots and their placards should have been removed. so the main speakers could have been heard. a loudspeaker, really?. The PM of Luxembourg found it amusing. it would appear. They need to all take a does of 'Grow the hell up' and realise they are interfering in political matters that they have not voted on. While they may not like the man or even his politics, he is our PM and represents all of us. like it or not, and he should be, if not shown respect, at least not have to deal with the 'pathetic placard numpties' when he is trying to negotiate politically. They should be ashamed of themselves. He did the right thing by walking away and refusing to engage. That was like the middle finger, to everyone of them. Good on you Boris!

replies.commentText: he just spouts a load old waffle and then does what scummings tells him to do. lets see if you still believe in him in a years time, if he makes it that long

“There needed to be a legally operational text to work on ‘as soon as possible’ if the October deadline was to be met, he added.” Err, no there doesn’t. The EU is in full panic mode now and desperately trying to hide their fear, unlike the utterly desperate remoaners who are constantly shrieking from the rooftops . 😂
